attributes.action: Allow self-employed people to pay their taxes monthly like PAYE employees.
attributes.additional_details: Entrepreneurship is the backbone of society yet self employed people are neglected when it comes to tax simplicity. We are required to pay for the previous tax year and make a 'payment on account' for the following tax year in one go. The process is confusing and means that most self-employed people need to pay for an accountant - this is not a fair way to spend earnings when the solution could be much simpler. Taxes for PAYE are deducted monthly so why can't this happen for the self-employed?
attributes.background: I want the government to streamline this process and make paying taxes simple. Self-employed people should be given the option to pay tax on a monthly basis, as PAYE employees currently do. The new process would mean that those in self-employment can 'pay as they go' and not need to pay in one go.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to income tax arrangements for self-employed people, but it's not clear exactly how you want this to work.

The way income tax works for self-employed people is different people people employed under PAYE, and it's not clear if you just want self-employed people to be able to pay income tax on a monthly basis, if you want other changes to how self-employed people are taxed, to simplify this process.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
